snippet: The Romney campaign clearly hasn’t thought about how eating only the tops of muffins will play to a crucial voting bloc: Asian immigrants.
abstract: Op-Ed article by Marie Myung-Ok Lee, a writing teacher at Columbia University, reflects on whether her first-generation Korean immigrant father would have supported Mitt Romney; observes that Romney supporters have been disseminating the story of how he likes to eat only the tops of muffins in an effort to make him more likeable; contends that such wastefulness would have been unappealing to her father, who would otherwise support Romney's candidacy wholeheartedly.
lead_paragraph: The Romney campaign clearly hasn’t thought about how eating only the tops of muffins will play to a crucial voting bloc: Asian immigrants.

headline.seo: My Asian Dad and Mitt Romney’s Muffin Tops
headline.main: What Muffins Say About Mitt Romney
headline.print_headline: What Muffins Say About Mitt Romney
